models.name: CEX - Order Book
models.description: Trade directly on exchange order books with limit/market orders. Requires KYC and exchange account. Best spreads but more complex UX.
models.howItWorks: Users deposit fiat via bank transfer, then place buy/sell orders on the exchange's order book. Pricing is determined by market makers and liquidity depth.
models.bestFor: High-volume traders, institutions, users comfortable with trading interfaces

models.name: CEX - Convert
models.description: Simple buy/sell interface on exchanges with instant conversion. Higher spread than order book but much simpler UX.
models.howItWorks: One-click conversion between fiat and stablecoins at a quoted price. The exchange handles order routing internally and charges a spread.
models.bestFor: Retail users, beginners, those who prefer simplicity over optimization

models.name: Issuer Window
models.description: Direct mint/redeem with stablecoin issuers like Circle or Tether. Lowest cost but high minimums ($100K+) and institutional access only.
models.howItWorks: Qualified institutions send USD directly to the issuer and receive newly minted stablecoins 1:1 (or vice versa for redemptions).
models.bestFor: Institutions, OTC desks, large treasury operations, market makers

models.name: Standalone Ramps
models.description: Third-party on/off-ramp services that can be embedded in wallets and dApps. Convenient but expensive, especially for card payments.
models.howItWorks: Widget-based checkout flow. Users enter payment details, complete KYC, and receive stablecoins directly to their wallet address.
models.bestFor: DeFi users, wallet users, those without exchange accounts, convenience-focused

models.name: OTC Desks
models.description: Over-the-counter trading for large volumes. Negotiated pricing with white-glove service. Typically $100K+ minimum.
models.howItWorks: Contact OTC desk, negotiate price and settlement terms, execute trade bilaterally. Often settles via bank wire + on-chain transfer.
models.bestFor: Institutions, funds, corporate treasuries, large individual holders

models.name: P2P Platforms
models.description: Peer-to-peer marketplaces matching buyers and sellers directly. Spreads vary widely by region and liquidity.
models.howItWorks: Users post buy/sell ads or take existing offers. Payment is made directly between peers (bank transfer, mobile money, cash). Platform provides escrow.
models.bestFor: Emerging markets, unbanked users, regions with restricted exchange access, privacy-conscious
